meanings.definition: The quality of having or showing great knowledge or learning.
meanings.sent1: Her eruditions on ancient history impressed the professor.
meanings.sent2: The book is filled with eruditions on various scientific topics.
meanings.sent3: Despite his young age, his eruditions on classical music were remarkable.
meanings.sent4: In the world of academia, her eruditions shone like a beacon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The library was a treasure trove of eruditions waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: A scholarly or learned piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The eruditions of the famous philosopher are still studied today.
meanings.sent2: The journal publishes eruditions on literary criticism every month.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eruditions on the art of napping were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His eruditions were like a symphony of words, captivating the readers.
meanings.sent5: The eruditions in the ancient manuscript revealed lost secrets of the past.
